Description: Cul sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: part of incised palmette with alternating added red and black fronds, red heart; part of both adjoining opposed palmettes and volutes with red collar in between.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1914,0317.7, 1965,0930.795 and 1965,0930.796.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 357, no. B459)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0741) (Phase 1)
